comment.author: 47524421@N08
comment._content:
Martin XT5M-1 BuNo A8051, powered by a 525 hp (391 kW) Pratt & Whitney R-1690-22 Hornet radial engine.  Similar to the Naval Aircraft Factory XT2N-1, and produced as the BM.  Tested as a two place carrier dive bomber, it was damaged during a terminal dive on October 15, 1929 - the lower starboard wing collapsed, but the airplane landed safely.  It was SOC May 31, 1934.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/7096831261/in/set-72157629861348693/]
